Action Flow Item
Action
is a
general term denoting the work performed by the assignee (user)
during the configured business process (BP).
An action type determines its specificity. To choose an action type, click the
button in its menu: a list of action types will open.
a
When working with the platform, the following task types are typically used:
Abstract Task is an
"Action" flow item
, a task without a specific type. The element setting up is given below;
User task is an action run by user. It is used and configured in the same way as an Abstract Task;
Service task
is a task run by the System;
Sub process
is an action in the System representing a separate business process.
Profile visuals
are configures independently by the Administrator.
On the BP flow chart, both the task and the subprocess are shown as rectangles with rounded corners:
The plus sign "+"
in the rectangle indicates that this
action is a subprocess
.
The description of actions can be introduced both in a pool (for more information, refer to the
Pool, Tracks zones of responsibility
), and without borders (the BP description without pools and tracks).
